title: Crush School 2: 10 Study Secrets Every High Schooler Should Know
features: If you have the right skills, you can figure out how to make soap or meth, build a website or a car, or code the next Snapchat or Pokemon GO. Even if you’re not interested in any of the things just mentioned, wouldn’t it be cool to know that you could if you wanted to?That’s what this book is about; gaining the skills and the confidence that will help you say I can do it, no matter what it is. This is what the future will require. If school sucks for you, just focus on learning, because you will need mad skills to survive in the urban jungle that awaits when you’re out. In Crush School 2: 10 Study Secrets Every High Schooler Should Know, Cymerman reveals that to be successful now and in the future, students need to focus on building skills, not learning subjects. In his book, the author lays out a detailed plan of how to get those skills.Who is this book for?STUDENTS: Learn how to learn anything effectively and be successful now and in the future.PARENTS: Help your children avoid frustration and prevent procrastination by giving them a better way to study and learn.TEACHERS & SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS: Give students a tool and a blueprint to follow so they can become lifelong learners.
description: Oskar Cymerman was born in Poland and is a product of the Chicago Public Schools. Is that a good thing? He's still figuring that one out.Oskar has taught science and engineering for the past 15 years. Oskar writes educational books for teachers and students, because most books for students suck.
Why can't books for students be awesome?
he thought, and he sat down to write the Crush School series.Oskar has a wife and a 3 year old. They live and hang out in Minneapolis.Twitter: @focus2achieve

He is also the founder and the chief creative engine at Focus 2 Achieve, a website and consulting business dedicated to help parents, teachers, and schools help teens learn and acquire school and work success skills effectively and efficiently.', 'Oskar writes, creates infographics, and speaks to further his mission of equipping parents and professionals working with teens with the tools that help teens and young adults become independent and self-reliant.', 'He has been featured in The Entrepreneur, The Teaching Channel, Bam Radio Network, Educators Lead, Education Talk Radio and other media outlets.', 'Oskar lives with his wife Kasia and a 4 1/2 year old son Adam in Minneapolis.', 'Free tools and resources for parents and teachers of teens at: www.focus2achieve.com']}
